ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.5_0: 81. The training rule on what is worn out
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian, who was the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.3_0: had a robe that was worn out.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.4_0: On one occasion the Sangha was given one robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.5_0: which it gave it to Dabba.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.6_0: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.7_0: “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.9_0: “How can the monks from the group of six give out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticize it afterwards?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.13_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.15_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.16.1_0: ‘If a monk gives out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.5_0: The Sangha is complete a unanimous Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.6_0: belonging to the same Buddhist sect and staying within the same monastic boundary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8_0: one of the six kinds of robes that is transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.12_0: saying, as a co-student, according to friendship, companions, and associates—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.14_0: it has been given to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.16_0: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicine; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18_0: when robe-cloth has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, and he has been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he criticizes the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he criticizes the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.4_0: If he criticizes the giving of another requisite, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.5_0: When robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, but he has not been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.6_0: When robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to someone who is not fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, whether he has been agreed upon by the Sangha as such or not, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.7_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.8_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they is unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.9_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.2_0: if he criticizes one who regularly acts from desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, saying, “What’s the point of giving it to him—he’ll ruin it or use it inappropriately;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.5_0: The eleventh rule, the training rule on what is worn out, is finished.
